channel.title: In need of quick help (very easy question)
channel.description:
Yep. I've made a little theifing/stall area in the middle of no where, now I just need to make a fence surrounding it so that nobody gets out. One problem...I need an id that works! (i've gone on the objects thing off the moparscape client, tried a bunch but they wont show up) Please, don't give me the hedge id, because I need something longer then that, and hopefully looks like a fence/gate. Please only give me ids that you know work...or atleast work on your server, if you have one. Thanks :)
Note: Please dont say that it's my fault that the ids arent working, because regular ids like stalls, the HEDGES, and everything else works. I just need a fence :l

item.title: In need of quick help (very easy question)
item.dc:creator: @Miss_Doctor Miss_Doctor
item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

…if I put a 0 at the end of it, the fence will magically appear? -.-

Read full topic

item.description:
@Miss_Doctor wrote:

this is what i’ve got…wtf is all that other stuff I JUST WaNT TO KNOW WHAT I NEED TO ADD! =[

[code] public void NewObjects() {

	makeGlobalObject(2653, 3141, 42, 0, 10);//Fishing Spot

	makeGlobalObject(3260, 3088, 1116, 0, 10);//Gate

	makeGlobalObject(3264, 3078, 6572, 0, 10);//Spice Stall
	makeGlobalObject(3264, 3084, 4707, 0, 10);//Fish Stall

item.title: In need of quick help (very easy question)
item.dc:creator: @Taylor_John0 Taylor John0
item.description:
@Taylor_John0 wrote:

I TAKE FULL RESPONSIBILITY FOR THAT

[code]public void Addaobject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType)
{
outStream.createFrame(85);
outStream.writeByteC(y - (mapRegionY * 8));
outStream.writeByteC(x - (mapRegionX * 8));

outStream.createFrame(151);
//outStream.writeByteA(((x&7) << 4) + (y&7));
outStream.writeByteA(0);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian(typeID);
outStream.writeByteS((tileObjectType<<2) +(orientation&3));
}

public void deletethatobject(int objectX, int objectY) {
ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 10);
}
public void NewObjects() {//X Y ID DIR 10 (Dir, 0=West -3=North -2=East -1=South)(Narbmark: OBJECTS)
AddGlobalObject(3207, 3405, 138, -2, 10);//dummy @ lair train
AddGlobalObject(3207, 3406, 138, -2, 10);//dummy
AddGlobalObject(3207, 3407, 138, -2, 10);//dummy
AddGlobalObject(3207, 3408, 138, -2, 10);//dummy
AddGlobalObject(3208, 3409, 138, -1, 10);//dummy
AddGlobalObject(3209, 3409, 138, -1, 10);//dummy
AddGlobalObject(3210, 3407, 138, 0, 10);//dummy
AddGlobalObject(3210, 3408, 138, 0, 10);//dummy
AddGlobalObject(3210, 3405, 138, 0, 10);//dummy
AddGlobalObject(3210, 3406, 138, 0, 10);//dummy
}
public void AddGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType)
{
outStream.createFrame(85);
outStream.writeByteC(y - (mapRegionY * 8));
outStream.writeByteC(x - (mapRegionX * 8));

outStream.createFrame(151);
//outStream.writeByteA(((x&7) << 4) + (y&7));
outStream.writeByteA(0);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian(typeID);
outStream.writeByteS((tileObjectType<<2) +(orientation&3));
}[/code]
That’s what I’ve got.

Read full topic
